text: restructuring policy principles system benefits charge amend rsa vi to read as follows benefits for all consumers restructuring of the electric utility industry should be implemented in a manner that benefits all consumers equitably and does not benefit one customer class to the detriment of another costs should not be shifted unfairly among customers a nonbypassable and competitively neutral system benefits charge applied to the use of the distribution system may be used to fund public benefits related to the provision of electricity such benefits as approved by regulators may include but not necessarily be limited to programs for customers energy efficiency programs whose main purpose is to reduce the consumption of electricity and not some other form of energy funding for the electric utility industry s share of commission expenses pursuant to rsa support for research and development and investments in commercialization strategies for new and beneficial technologies legislative prior approval of by either the passage of legislation by the new hampshire general court or authorization by the fiscal committee of the general court shall be required to increase the system benefits charge this requirement of prior approval of the new hampshire general court shall not apply to the energy efficiency portion of the system benefits charge if the increase is authorized by an order of the commission to implement the planning periods of the energy efficiency resource standard framework established by commission order no dated august ending in and or if for purposes other than implementing the energy efficiency resource standard is authorized by the fiscal committee of the general court provided however that no less than percent of the portion of the funds collected for energy efficiency shall be expended on energy efficiency programs energy efficiency programs should include the development of relationships with lending institutions to provide opportunities for financing of energy efficiency measures to leverage available funds to the maximum extent and shall also include funding for workforce development to minimize waiting periods for energy audits and weatherization
